model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.
Speaker B: Well thankfully I don't have that problem these days, I get to spend some great time with my grandkids. Have you thought any more about the idea of our annual fishing trip? 
Speaker A: Yes, I think you should start planning this with your family and try and do different locations every year so that it changes up the scenery
Speaker B: Yes I think that's a great idea, how is work at the library? 

MEMORY:
Speaker A loves kids and works as a librarian, mentioning having 3 children. Speaker B mentions having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.

Speaker B's kids do not go to work by boat like Speaker A. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker B took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids.

Speaker B has a lot of kids, all grown up now and with kids of their own. Speaker B mentions having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker A has children and grandchildren, with at least one child interested in learning the flute.

prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY provides information about Speaker A's job as a librarian, their family situation with children, and hints at their interest in spending time with kids, which aligns with Speaker B's mention of grandkids and considering the fishing trip. This context about Speaker A's work and family is directly relevant to the question posed by Speaker B about work at the library, helping to form a relevant and informed response.

Judgement: "Yes"
